ygData.subject: Re: Dark Awakening, part 3
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: I had to get them back, at least just to make an appearance. They won t leave Cybertron, promise! On the surface, a couple of meters higher, the patrol

OOC: I had to get them back, at least just to make an appearance. They
won't leave Cybertron, promise!

On the surface, a couple of meters higher, the patrol tech noticed
something on the instruments.

Gesper: Sir, I have a reading. This looks like a non-repertoriated
energy signature, but it seems to be vaguely techno-nanitite... It's
weird in any cases.

Belthassan, the huge polar bear stopped and looked back at the monkey.
He took a few steps forward and frowned. He thought they had taken out
all resistance, but for a techno-nanitite reading, it had to be
another Tripredacus.

Belthassan: Can you confirm affiliation?

Gesper: No, it's too archaic. It doesn't even recognize it. The only
thing I have is a spark signature.

Belthassan: We'll go check. Where is it?

Gesper: It's down, in the underground.

Belthassan: Old Iacon City... Could it be? Melchana, find a shaft and
start scouting. We're right behind you.

Melchana transformed and let shine her armblades.

Melchana: With pleasure! And yes, I'll wait your order before I engage.

She jumped in the nearest waste shaft and looked around. Silent, she
listened to the noises.

Melchana: Bel, I think I hear a voice...

Belthassan: Got it. Move out as silently as possible. HQ is warned. We
are to terminate it if it's hostile, but not before.

Melchana: Roger.

She advanced and descended lower. At the end of the pipe, she came in
a large vault-like place. She saw a ledge and jumped on it, but her
clawed feet made a scraping sound that echoed all around. Mentally,
she swore and her hunter instincts kicked in. The lioness had to find
her prey now!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> Light was seen as she neared the end of a shaft. Padding along at a
decent 
> pace. 
> 
> At the opening of the shaft, glancing about outside to see a very
different 
> Cyberton that what she was used to.. from what she remembered. 
> 
> "No," she whispered. A pain in her voice. It wasn't that familiar 
> metallic/robotic voice that was so familiar to her, but such a plain, 
> ordinary organic like voice. 
> 
> A curiousity sprung up within her. She wanted to see if any part of
Cybertron 
> remained as it was. Or was it all a mix of this organic & cybernetic? 
> 
> ******************************
> 
> Padding along in the shadows & alleys, much like Ravage once did.
Her optics 
> glanced about, taking in this new Cybertron, much to her grief &
distaste. 
> 
> It pained her. & surely enough, it would have pained any Decepticon.
Even 
> worse, she was disgraced for being reformated into this organic like
body. 
> 
> Sad & lonely, for the first time in her existance, her thoughts went
to her 
> past. Thinking about the days of the Great War, the Decepticons. The
battles 
> with the Autobots, Cybertron as it once was. Energon. Her rivals with 
> Elita-1. 
> 
> Megatron. She felt so ashamed. If he were functioning & standing
before her, 
> she would beg him to either return her to her former body or help
her to 
> permenantly cease to function.  
> 
> As she moved through the alleys & shadows of the streets of Cybertron, 
> Megatron's faceplate remained the dominant figure in her mind. If
she could 
> see him again, she would be reassured.
